definitions.definition: Straw , grass , and similar loose material used as bedding for people or animals .
A bed , especially a pile of straw with blankets &c. used as a bed .
A mobile bed or couch transported upon or suspended from poles placed over human shoulders or animal backs .

subdefinitions.definition: Synonym of stretcher , such a vehicle used for transporting the sick and injured , inclusive of designs carried in the hand .
The general category of all such similar vehicles , inclusive of sedan chairs , hammock litters , and the like .

definitions.definition: An act of giving birth to a number of live young at the same time .
Synonym of straw , grass , &c. more generally , particularly in plaster , thatch , and mulch .
The whole group of live young born at the same time , typically in reference to mammals or ( figurative , derogatory ) unpleasant people or objects .
examples: The runt of the litter is the smallest or weakest of a group of puppies born together.

definitions.definition: Waste or debris , originally any mess but now particularly trash left or thrown on the ground .
examples: What are you doing ?! There's a litter bin not three feet away.

definitions.definition: Animal bedding together with its dung .
A bed , a substrate formed from loose materials .
The layer of fallen leaves and other loose organic material on the ground in a forest .
examples: Forest animals use leaf litter in a variety of ways, including as food, shelter, nesting material, bedding, and camouflage.

definitions.definition: Fuller's earth , clay pellets , wood chips , or other similar loose absorbent materials used for the waste of pet animals .
examples: Change the cat litter fer chrissakes . This place reeks.

main_definition: ( uncountable ) Straw , grass , and similar loose material used as bedding for people or animals .
secondary_definitions: ( countable , obsolete ) A bed , especially a pile of straw with blankets &c. used as a bed .
( countable ) A mobile bed or couch transported upon or suspended from poles placed over human shoulders or animal backs . [1330s]
( countable , obsolete ) An act of giving birth to a number of live young at the same time .
( uncountable , obsolete ) Synonym of straw , grass , &c. more generally , particularly in plaster , thatch , and mulch .
( countable ) The whole group of live young born at the same time , typically in reference to mammals or ( figurative , derogatory ) unpleasant people or objects .
( uncountable ) Waste or debris , originally any mess but now particularly trash left or thrown on the ground .
( uncountable ) Animal bedding together with its dung .
( countable , uncommon ) A bed , a substrate formed from loose materials .
( uncountable ) The layer of fallen leaves and other loose organic material on the ground in a forest .
( uncountable ) Fuller's earth , clay pellets , wood chips , or other similar loose absorbent materials used for the waste of pet animals .
